channel.title: Odd pets
channel.description:
Decided to buy a tarantula today as they're pretty gnarly. What strange pets do you guys have?
[IMG]http://i50.photobucket.com/albums/f304/surfdude2012/DSCN0923.jpg[/img]
Dogs and cats are for newfags.

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

It grew too big for the house so it moved to the hay barn. One day my dad was showing it to his friends, when it ran under their car and sat on a wheel where they couldnt see it. Found it flat the next day.

Read full topic

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

runescape3dude:

I used to have a possum: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KuFBe5Q6-Sc He got real tame after a month, but ended up getting run over by a car.

That’s kind of cute and cuddly for a possum :p. Why was it outside where it could get run over in the first place?

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:70, topic:360903”][quote author=Rix_ link=topic=457193.msg3532403#msg3532403 date=1300278492]
Wow and that young tarantula is going to grow to be one heck of a motherfucker!
[/quote]

Just watched this and then saw this:

It starts ripping its flesh open 'n shit. Though, one thing that /slightly/ annoyed me in the first video is the woman claiming that putting a live mouse, without any chance of escape into a tank with the spider is nature.

No it isn’t. I’m not bothered by them feeding them live animals or anything like that, I just can’t stand people who claim stuff like that is nature because it isn’t.[/quote]Idd, according to comments thought spiders wouldn’t even eat a mouse and it could be bad for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You definitely can’t de-fang Tarantulas, they need fangs/venom to eat. I’d be more concerned of them launching their hairs into my eyes than getting bitten. Maniown blatantly a ballsy bastard! I used to hold spiders no problem, in fact I held a Goliath bird eater when I was about 11. For some reason with age I’ve just grown increasingly more nervous by them :s It’s odd.

I’d rather have a pet that can grow an attachment to me though, as arachnids have no capability for that (cannibal bastards!) plus you’re not really supposed to hold them, more for their safety than yours. They’re quite fragile creatures. Having said that it is cool that you can just chill with a huge spider on your hand, makes for a good pic and I hear it’s not even too bad because they enjoy the warmth (hence the non-aggression).

I was reading the funnelweb’s wiki and came across the mention of finding one in the UK! http://www.aroundglobe.net/2010/08/has-one-of-worlds-deadliest-spiders.html
However no real proof. Apparently those bastards can bite through your finger nails. Holy shit!

Read full topic

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Rix_:

Wow and that young tarantula is going to grow to be one heck of a motherfucker!

The only reason one should allowed to carry a gun: To kill those motherfucking spiders! If I had a gun, and was at the location that poor mouse was about to get killed, I’d fire a fucking barrage at that fucking spider.

Damn, I hate spiders. I’m going to establish an anti-spider action front, anyone care to join in?

Read full topic

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

They can’t defang or take out the poison of a tarantula. Its how they kill and eat there prey. You just take the risk when holding them. Every pet store and online tarantula dealer has a big warning stating that tarantulas are not made to be held and to do so at your own risk.

Also most tarantulas are not as deadly as you would think. Yeah it wouldn’t feel good to get bit, but no it wouldn’t put your life at risk. The most you have to do is get a shot at the hospital to stop you from being in quite a bit of pain.

Read full topic

I got a second tarantula yesterday… Its a Goliath bird eater.

Surprisingly she lets me hold her, but she doesn’t like that pencil very much…

Her name is Shah-knee-qua. (all my pets get black ghetto names)

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:56, topic:360903”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=457193.msg3350194#msg3350194 date=1285214089]

FUCK OFF WITH THE SPIDERS WOWOWOWOW THIS IS WHY I DONT LIKE AUSTRALIA, I SWEAR ILL MOVE ONE DAY.

this.

You’re not an Australian if you haven’t had a big one of them motherfuckers crawl across your computer screen or scare the shit out of you somehow when you’re playing the computer. Worst experience I had with a spider, that I can remember, was when it was really hot one day and I went and jumped in my pool. As I was in the air, I saw a big funnelweb (I think it was a funnelweb?) on the bottom of the pool.

Do they teach you how to deal with these pests in the army?

No you learn it as you grow up… use your shoe!

No really, I thought especially in the Australian army they would have taught you something about dealing with pests. I’m sure being in the army involves being in the outback where you’re likely to face snakes/spiders.
[/quote]
You do survival training, which would likely include how to avoid/defend yourself against native fauna.[/quote]

Defensive strategy #1.

Read full topic

item.title: Odd pets
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:52, topic:360903”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=457193.msg3349704#msg3349704 date=1285174253]
After reading from this thread, I no longer think my fear of spiders is irrational.
[/quote]
Yeah, haha. Glad to see I’m not the only one o.o[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=457193.msg3349670#msg3349670 date=1285171031]

There is not one animal I hate more than spiders.

I agree. Here the biggest spider around is still slightly smaller than the palm of your hand, but I still hate them. My preferred way of killing them though, which I found to be very effective, is with starter fluid or carb cleaner, you barely have to spritz them and they basically die immediately. Then to be confident they are dead, you can light them on fire and watch their legs burn off. But they always die straight away after the spray anyhow.
[/quote]
Woah, that’s a little brutal. Personally I just smack them with my shoe.[/quote]

Then you gotta clean up the gunk though, if you spray them and kill them they just roll up into a ball you can throw or roll away.

Read full topic
